title: The maximum Wiener index of maximal planar graphs
abstract: The Wiener index of a connected graph is the sum of the distances between all pairs of vertices in the graph. It was conjectured that the Wiener index of an n-vertex maximal planar graph is at most $$\lfloor \frac{1}{18}(n^3+3n^2)\rfloor $$ . We prove this conjecture and determine the unique n-vertex maximal planar graph attaining this maximum, for every $$ n\ge 10$$ .
